required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Resveratrol Supplementation in Healthy Humans
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Chronic Trans- Resveratrol Supplementation on Aspects of Cognitive Performance, Mood, Sleep, Health and Cerebral Blood Flow in Healthy, Young Humans.

brief_summary.textblock: The effects of chronic resveratrol supplementation have yet to be investigated in healthy humans. It is hypothesised that the effects will be different to those seen in acute supplementation. This study will look specifically at cognitive performance, cerebral blood flow, subjective sleep, mood and health, blood pressure and plasma levels of resveratrol. It is hypothesized that these measures will be affected differently by acute and chronic supplementation.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Chronic Modulation of Cerebral Blood Flow
primary_outcome.time_frame: 40- 80 minutes post- dose on day 28 of supplementation
primary_outcome.description: Cerebral blood flow (CBF) was measured in the frontal cortex with Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS). Modulation was deemed to have taken place if levels differed significantly from day 1 to day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Modulated Mood
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective mood was assessed with the Profile of mood states (POMS) questionnaire every 7 days during the 28- day period. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of mood if their scores on week 1, week 2, week 3 and/or week 4 differed significantly from scores on the baseline questionnaire completed on day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Modulated Cognitive Performance
secondary_outcome.description: Cognitive performance was assessed by a range of cognitively demanding tasks on day 28 of the supplementation period. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of cognitive performance if their scores on these tasks were significantly different from scores taken on day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of Sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective perception of sleep quality was assessed with the PSQI. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of sleep if scores on Week 1, Week 2, Week 3 and/or Week 4 differed significantly from those on day 1 (baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of Health
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective perceptions of health were assessed with the General Health Questionnaire. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of health if scores on Week 1, Week 2, Week 3 and/or Week 4 differed significantly from day 1 (baseline) completion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of blood pressure if their readings on day 28 differed significantly from that taken on day 1 (baseline).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of CBF in MCA
secondary_outcome.description: CBF was assessed in the middle cerebral artery (MCA) with Trans-cranial doppler via a trans- temporal acoustic window. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of CBF in the MCA if readings differed significantly from those obtained on day 1 (baseline).

arm_group.description: Methyl Cellulose administered in identical capsules as the active.
Transmax from biotivia. 500mg resveratrol (98% purity) with 10mg piperine per capsule. 1 capsule taken daily.

intervention.description: Transmax (Biotivia). 500mg (1 capsule) per day for 28 days.
Methyl Cellulose. 1 capsule taken once daily for 28 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- Between 18-35
- At least enrolled on undergraduate degree programme
- Native English speaker
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoking
- Taking other medication/ supplements
- Pregnant/ breast feeding
- High caffeine consumers
- Migraine sufferers

facility.name: Brain performance and nutrition research centre, Northumbria university

participant_flow.recruitment_details: All participants were recruited opportunistically from Northumbria University via spam email and posters around campus.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Before participants were enrolled they were required to complete a training/screening session. If they met the study exclusion criteria or did not perform within the cognitive task norms (compiled from previous studies) then they were not eligible to take part in the study.

group.title: 500mg Resveratrol
group.description: Transmax from biotivia. 500mg resveratrol (98% purity) with 10mg piperine per capsule. 1 capsule taken daily. Resveratrol : Transmax (Biotivia). 500mg (1 capsule) per day for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Methyl Cellulose administered in identical capsules as the active. Placebo : Methyl Cellulose. 1 capsule taken once daily for 28 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Chronic Modulation of Cerebral Blood Flow
outcome.description: Cerebral blood flow (CBF) was measured in the frontal cortex with Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS). Modulation was deemed to have taken place if levels differed significantly from day 1 to day 28.
outcome.time_frame: 40- 80 minutes post- dose on day 28 of supplementation
outcome.population: Participants were included in the analysis if they provided full NIRS readings on session 1 and session 2.

group.title: 500mg Resveratrol
group.description: Transmax from biotivia. 500mg resveratrol (98% purity) with 10mg piperine per capsule. 1 capsule taken daily. Resveratrol : Transmax (Biotivia). 500mg (1 capsule) per day for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Methyl Cellulose administered in identical capsules as the active. Placebo : Methyl Cellulose. 1 capsule taken once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Chronic Modulation of Cerebral Blood Flow
measure.description: Cerebral blood flow (CBF) was measured in the frontal cortex with Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS). Modulation was deemed to have taken place if levels differed significantly from day 1 to day 28.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Modulated Mood
outcome.description: Subjective mood was assessed with the Profile of mood states (POMS) questionnaire every 7 days during the 28- day period. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of mood if their scores on week 1, week 2, week 3 and/or week 4 differed significantly from scores on the baseline questionnaire completed on day 1.
outcome.population: Participants were included in the final analysis if they had completed all questionnaires correctly.

group.title: 500mg Resveratrol
group.description: Transmax from biotivia. 500mg resveratrol (98% purity) with 10mg piperine per capsule. 1 capsule taken daily. Resveratrol : Transmax (Biotivia). 500mg (1 capsule) per day for 28 days.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Methyl Cellulose administered in identical capsules as the active. Placebo : Methyl Cellulose. 1 capsule taken once daily for 28 days.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Modulated Mood
measure.description: Subjective mood was assessed with the Profile of mood states (POMS) questionnaire every 7 days during the 28- day period. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of mood if their scores on week 1, week 2, week 3 and/or week 4 differed significantly from scores on the baseline questionnaire completed on day 1.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Modulated Cognitive Performance
outcome.description: Cognitive performance was assessed by a range of cognitively demanding tasks on day 28 of the supplementation period. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of cognitive performance if their scores on these tasks were significantly different from scores taken on day 1.
outcome.population: All participants who properly completed all repetitions of all tasks on both days were included in the analysis.

group.title: 500mg Resveratrol
group.description: Transmax from biotivia. 500mg resveratrol (98% purity) with 10mg piperine per capsule. 1 capsule taken daily. Resveratrol : Transmax (Biotivia). 500mg (1 capsule) per day for 28 days.

Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of cognitive performance if their scores on these tasks were significantly different from scores taken on day 1.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of Sleep
outcome.description: Subjective perception of sleep quality was assessed with the PSQI. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of sleep if scores on Week 1, Week 2, Week 3 and/or Week 4 differed significantly from those on day 1 (baseline).
outcome.population: All participants who completed their questionnaires correctly were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of blood pressure if their readings on day 28 differed significantly from that taken on day 1 (baseline).
outcome.population: All participants who provided all BP readings across the study were included in the analysis.

measure.description: Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of blood pressure if their readings on day 28 differed significantly from that taken on day 1 (baseline).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Significant Modulation of CBF in MCA
outcome.description: CBF was assessed in the middle cerebral artery (MCA) with Trans-cranial doppler via a trans- temporal acoustic window. Participants were deemed to have significant modulation of CBF in the MCA if readings differed significantly from those obtained on day 1 (baseline).
outcome.population: All participants who were part of the TCD component, who could provide a consistent blood flow trace, were included in the analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
